identificationModule.briefTitle: A Dose-ranging Study in Patients With Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain (DPNP)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2b, Dose-ranging, Randomized, Double-blind, PlacebO-controlled, Parallel-GRoup, MulticEnter Study in PatientS With Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain (PROGRESS)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Evaluation of the efficacy of LX9211 compared to placebo in reducing DPNP. Please see study website: https://diabeticpainstudy.com/

armGroups.label: LX9211 Low Dose
armGroups.description: LX9211 low dose, orally, once daily during a blinded treatment period.

armGroups.label: LX9211 High Dose
armGroups.description: LX9211 high dose, orally, once daily during a blinded treatment period.

armGroups.label: LX9211 High Dose Followed by Low Dose
armGroups.description: LX9211 high dose followed by LX9211 low dose, orally, once daily during a blinded treatment period.

armGroups.label: LX9211 Placebo
armGroups.description: LX9211 matching placebo, orally, once daily during a blinded treatment period.

interventions.name: LX9211 (blinded)
armGroupLabels: LX9211 High Dose Followed by Low Dose

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 8 in Average Daily Pain Score (ADPS)
primaryOutcomes.description: ADPS is based on the 11-point numerical rating scale (NRS) \[0 (no pain) to 10 (worst imaginable pain)\].

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 8 in Burning Pain
secondaryOutcomes.description: Burning pain is based on the 11-point NRS (0 \[no burning\] to 10 \[worst burning imaginable\]).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 8 in Pain Interference on Sleep
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pain interference on sleep is based on the 11-point NRS (0 \[does not interfere\] to 10 \[completely interferes\]).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) Score at Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: The PGIC is a 7-point rating scale that assesses a participant's belief about the overall improvement experienced by the participant where 1=very much improved and 7=very much worse.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 8 in Total Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: NPSI total score is based on 5 subscales evaluating different symptoms of neuropathic pain, each evaluated on a scale of 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain). The total score ranges from 0 to 100. A higher score indicates a worse outcome.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Participant has given written informed consent to participate in the study in accordance with local regulations
2. Adult male and female participants ≥18 years of age at the Screening Visit
3. Body mass index ≥18.0 to ≤40.0 kilogram per meter square (kg/m\^2) at Screening
4. Diagnosis of type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM) or type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) with chronic DPNP, at Screening
5. Pain from DPNP present for at least 6 months prior to Screening
6. At the Screening Visit, glycosylated hemoglobin (A1C) must be ≤11%.
7. Stable regimen for the treatment of T1DM or T2DM for ≥3 months prior to Screening
8. Willing to adhere to the prohibitions and restrictions specified in the protocol.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Presence of other painful conditions that may confound assessment or self-evaluation of DPNP
2. History of neurolytic or neurosurgical therapy for DPNP
3. Use of opioid medications for management of DPNP within the 2 months prior to the Screening Visit.
4. Use of prescription topical analgesics (eg, capsaicin) indicated for neuropathic pain within 3 months prior to Screening
5. Use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) less than 2 weeks prior to Screening
